message.content:
cs.CV, cs.GR, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL 

This paper deals with learning representations of 3D shapes for semantic segmentation tasks. The paper uses point embedding networks and metric learning approaches to generate vectorial representations of 3D points that reflect the grouping hierarchy and tag data. This work is relevant to computer vision (cs.CV) as it deals with 3D shape representations and semantic segmentation. It also involves graphics (cs.GR) as it deals with 3D shapes and their geometric relations. The paper also uses machine learning techniques such as metric learning and point embedding networks, which are relevant to machine learning (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper deals with tag data, which is relevant to natural language processing (cs.CL).
